Package sample.Java

Class ImageMetaData

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.Java.ImageMetaData
  • public class ImageMetaData
extends java.lang.Object
    ImageMetaData is a class which is used to collect all metadata from a image, using the Metadata-extractor API

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ImageMetaData​(java.io.File imageFile)
      This constructor takes the image file as a parameter
      Uses a method from the metadata-extractor API to read metadata from the given image-file

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String checkFileType()
      Method for finding out what the type of file the image is
      java.util.Date getDateFromMetaData()
      A method for retrieving the date the image was created/captured by looking for a specific Date-tag in the ExifIFD0Directory
      Not all images gives the information we need to read the date
      com.drew.lang.GeoLocation getGeoDataFromMetadata()
      This method returns the location in the form of a Geolocation object.
      int getHeightFromMetadata()
      Method for fetching height from image based in what datatype the image is (jpeg, png or gif)
      java.sql.Timestamp getTimeFromMetaData()
      This method returns timestamp from when the image was taken by looking for a specific Datetime-tag in the ExifIFD0Directory
      int getWidthFromMetadata()
      Method for fetching width from image based on what datatype the image is (jpeg, png or gif)
      void printMetaDataFromImage()
      This method prints out metadata from an image and displays it in a defined order

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageMetaData

        public ImageMetaData​(java.io.File imageFile)
        This constructor takes the image file as a parameter
        Uses a method from the metadata-extractor API to read metadata from the given image-file
        Parameters:
        imageFile - the image file that will be read

    • Method Detail

      • printMetaDataFromImage

        public void printMetaDataFromImage()
        This method prints out metadata from an image and displays it in a defined order

      • getWidthFromMetadata

        public int getWidthFromMetadata()
                         throws com.drew.metadata.MetadataException
        Method for fetching width from image based on what datatype the image is (jpeg, png or gif)
        Returns:
        the width as an Integer
        Throws:
        com.drew.metadata.MetadataException

      • getHeightFromMetadata

        public int getHeightFromMetadata()
                          throws com.drew.metadata.MetadataException
        Method for fetching height from image based in what datatype the image is (jpeg, png or gif)
        Returns:
        the image height as an Integer
        Throws:
        com.drew.metadata.MetadataException

      • getDateFromMetaData

        public java.util.Date getDateFromMetaData()
        A method for retrieving the date the image was created/captured by looking for a specific Date-tag in the ExifIFD0Directory
        Not all images gives the information we need to read the date
        Returns:
        the date stored in the metadata

      • getTimeFromMetaData

        public java.sql.Timestamp getTimeFromMetaData()
        This method returns timestamp from when the image was taken by looking for a specific Datetime-tag in the ExifIFD0Directory
        Returns:
        the timestamp stored in the metadata

      • getGeoDataFromMetadata

        public com.drew.lang.GeoLocation getGeoDataFromMetadata()
        This method returns the location in the form of a Geolocation object. This method can later be used for extracting the longitude and latitude
        Returns:
        the geoLocation stored in the metadata

      • checkFileType

        public java.lang.String checkFileType()
        Method for finding out what the type of file the image is
        Returns:
        the type of file as a String
